page.title: 05History of school, Crowedge
page.content: Early in this century in this area there were three schools to teach children throughout their school lives unless pupils had the good fortune to go to Penistone Grammar School. Dunford{Hazlehead School}was opened in November 1900 with 27 pupils and 2 teachers. There was a school at both{ {Carlecotes}and{Townhead.}By 1902 there were 83 children on roll as the result of Carlecotes school closing and 48 children been transferred. Until 1952 it was an "all age" school at which time children over 11 years of age were transferred to Thurlstone. From 1957 these children went to{Penistone {Grammer School}which had become a Comprehensive school. In 1963 Townhead school closed and transferred children brought the roll to 83 rising briefly in the mid 1970's to about 120. In 1985 there are now 48 children.
